data.name: Prevention of torture
data.part1: The European Committee for the prevention of torture visits places of detention
data.part2: (for juvenile or immigration detainees, police stations, psychiatric hospitals) in order to assess how persons deprived of their liberty are treated.

data.name: Fight against racism
data.part1: The European Commission against Racism and Intolerance (ECRI) is an independent monitoring body which provides member
data.part2: States with concrete and practical advice on how to tackle problems of racism and intolerance in their country.

data.name: Protection of social rights
data.part1: The European Social Charter is a Council of Europe treaty which guarantees social and economic human rights. It was adopted in 1961 and revised in 1996
data.part2: The European Committee of Social Rights rules on the conformity of the situation in States with the European Social Charter, the 1988 Additional Protocol and the Revised European Social Charter.

data.name: Protection of minorities
data.part1: The Framework Convention for the Protection of National Minorities provides for a monitoring system to evaluate how the treaty is implemented in State Parties
data.part2: An advisory Committee adopts recommendations to improve minority protection. France has not signed the Convention.

data.name: Fight against corruption
data.part1: The Group of States against Corruption (GRECO) monitors member states' compliance with the Council of Europe anti-corruption
data.part2: standards with the objective to improve the capacity of its members to fight corruption.

data.name: Democracy through Law
data.part1: he European Commission for Democracy through Law - the Venice Commission - is an advisory body on constitutional matters which plays a leading role in the adoption
data.part2: of constitutions that conform to the standards of Europe's constitutional heritage
